post.body: Dammit, I can't post pictures nor link them. Can I, _at least_, use **Markdown**?

I'm now hosting my own ZeroNet website! [espectalll.bit](/espectalll.bit)

_(next step is to add stuff to it)_

My first post is done! And its name is...

# Well, here's new content (which also just seems to happen to be the true introductory post)

[blog.espectalll.bit/?Post:4](/blog.espectalll.bit/?Post:4)

Another post, this one is in Spanish!

# ZeroNet, la red que me ha cambiado (un poco) la vida

_(basically, a "quick" intro to ZeroNet, in Spanish)_ [blog.espectalll.bit/?Post:5](/blog.espectalll.bit/?Post:5)
I didn't forget you, ZeroNet. **You rock!**

For those who hablan españolo, here's a guide by [@eibriel](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Profile/1BLueGvui1GdbtsjcKqCf4F67uKfritG49/1BYU9zV786auJ29dF3HMAQYhxA2WgN4ofi/eibriel@zeroid.bit) on how to make your own ZeroNet website! _(eso sí, sin información sobre dominios Namecoin)_

[1EMcXwk7qQdY3pbj86A98gZHjDBNRrscdL/?Post:38](/1EMcXwk7qQdY3pbj86A98gZHjDBNRrscdL/?Post:38)

Went off ZeroNet for way *too* long – now I'm impressed by the progress! File hosting, translations, really easy self-publishing, notifications and pictures on ZeroMe… and less bugs! Wow!

So glad to be back, hopefully I can deliver with my blog posting promises this time! See you soon, and Merry (late) Christmas :3

Heya, it's me, back at it again with the dankest websites on the decentralized world! x3

I come with good news: *finally!*, after a long time struggling to get my online presence in order, I can happily say that my official, functional website is being hosted at ZeroNet! No weird CSS or JS, no useless parallax, no sassy tech demos with WebGL or `<canvas>` – just a friendly, simple website with all your basic @espectalll facts and links.

P.S.: on the process of getting the website done, I found out that I lost my keys (I protected them using a Keybase key that was disabled…), so I had to create new pages and update my domains. If [espectalll.bit](/espectalll.bit) shows up the old "こんにちは" website, please try the current addresses:

[1XerzRpHi54PpoA6PJVgKYiLCEzM6Peh7](/1XerzRpHi54PpoA6PJVgKYiLCEzM6Peh7)
[1Xerz2RiNFG2zX5WsiXVRA78Q9UBsejDL](/1Xerz2RiNFG2zX5WsiXVRA78Q9UBsejDL)

As you may know, there's a lot of controversy on Systemd. You know, binary stuff, incompatible logs, D-Bus handling, Red Hat plans for the New World Order – don't worry tho, here's a post by Lennart Poettering on how true are all of those claims: http://0pointer.de/blog/projects/the-biggest-myths.html

comment.body: Preparing a blog as well, currently at [1PpQgtDVqXjiLyfPdQbV4BG5PZs8McCmtw](/1PpQgtDVqXjiLyfPdQbV4BG5PZs8McCmtw). Let's see if I can put is as a subdomain...
OK, it's already available! And it's so delicious! [blog.espectalll.bit](/blog.espectalll.bit)
One month later, still the same spirit! :3

This was actually written back on January 2013, it's actually surprising that I'd never seen this article before. But then I guess most of people haven't, so please take a moment to read it if you're among such people :3
